publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5347 Robin Harper: Play and the Curriculum for Excellence—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Executive on the decision to encourage primary school P1 teachers to use more play-based techniques using art, music and drama; urges the Executive to back this policy with appropriate training and support, including more visiting specialist teachers; recognises that music, art, drama and play are central to the development of young people’s full creative, social and academic potential, and calls for this ethos to be extended throughout the school curriculum in primary and secondary schools, recognising that play, including sport, outdoor education, education in the outdoors and the creative arts, is central to the development of healthy, confident and successful young people in Scotland.
S2M-5347 Play and the Curriculum for Excellence (lodged on 18 December 2006) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mark Ballard*, Eleanor Scott*, Shiona Baird*, Patrick Harvie*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-5347 Play and the Curriculum for Excellence (lodged on 18 December 2006) Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, John Swinburne*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Jean Turner*, Elaine Smith*
